"what are you gonna do jack huh? What do you do?"
You cry. :'(:'(

item.title: Dennis Hopper Dies at 74 After Cancer Battle
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
look at the last pic of the gallery on the website catzeyes linked … poor man … :’(

EDIT: 74 is a good age though, my grandpa died this year at the age of 63, 4days before his 64. birthday

Read full topic

item.title: Dennis Hopper Dies at 74 After Cancer Battle
item.dc:creator: DansonDelta40
item.description:
Hopper is beyond pain and fear now. He has deserved his rest, I think. He brought so much pleasure and entertainment to so many people.

item.title: Dennis Hopper Dies at 74 After Cancer Battle
item.dc:creator: Ballsopt
item.description:
I saw his skullcap in 2001, a few months prior to 9/11. In a building outside of D.C. that no longer exists.
if there was something of his inside a grave, it’s probably not intact.

but you were probably joking anyways.

item.title: Dennis Hopper Dies at 74 After Cancer Battle
item.dc:creator: DeleteThis
item.description:
Sign of the apocalypse
Humanity’s greatest heroes will die, leaving a bunch of unliked untalented people to take their place
Next we’ll see a news report that Abraham Lincoln’s body has been mysteriously taken from its grave…

item.source: Dennis Hopper Dies at 74 After Cancer Battle

item.title: Dennis Hopper Dies at 74 After Cancer Battle
item.dc:creator: Ballsopt
item.description:
YOU FUCKERRR

YOU FUCKERRRR

YOU FFFUCK

rest in pieces, Denny boy.


434×579 79.7 KB

also

Why can’t the assholes like RUSH LIMBURGER die already!?

why all the cool, or interesting people!?

also, I’m telling you, it’s a California thing.
Pharmaceutical companies rushing out mal-tested drugs coinciding with the DSM-V? Watchmen style, selected-cancer? (remember swayze)

I still say it’s mighty fishy what’s been going on.

Read full topic

a decent actor for the role of Wallace Breen in a Half-Life movie…

item.title: Dennis Hopper Dies at 74 After Cancer Battle
item.dc:creator: BerZerK
item.description:
A damn shame, he was a really great actor, and in my opinion the only one who could have been a decent actor for the role of Wallace Breen in a Half-Life movie…

Rest in peace, Dennis.

Read full topic
